revised_title: Newton's Experiments on the Composition of White Light
tldr: This article discusses Newton's experiments on the composition of white light, focusing on his famous prism experiment. Newton discovered that white light is made up of different colors that can be separated by a prism. He also found that each color has a different refractive index, which led to the development of the field of spectroscopy. This discovery challenged the prevailing view of light as a single, indivisible entity and laid the foundation for modern optics and color theory.
